senses.de: Free time when you are not working or doing other duties.
senses.ex: She spends her leisure time reading books.

Tips.title: Non-Work Context
Tips.description: Leisure assumes non-working scenarios, so don't use it to describe pauses in work.
Tips.example: I’m looking forward to the weekend for some much-needed leisure.

Tips.title: Personal Choice
Tips.description: "Leisure time" is often intentional and chosen personally, not just free time.
Tips.example: During my leisure time, I prefer to write poetry.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Leisure has a positive feeling, evoking relaxation and pleasure, rather than boredom.
Tips.example: After months of hard work, their vacation was full of leisure.

senses.de: Relating to activities that are done for enjoyment during free time.
senses.ex: He wore his leisure suit to the party.

Tips.title: Informal Settings
Tips.description: The adjective form often suggests informal situations and clothes.
Tips.example: He’s got a collection of leisure suits for weekend outings.

Tips.title: Enjoyment Focused
Tips.description: Leisure activities are primarily for enjoyment, not competitive or work-related.
Tips.example: Swimming is my preferred leisure activity, as it relaxes me.

senses.ex: We can leave at our leisure.

Tips.title: No Rush
Tips.description: "At our leisure" implies no need for speed or haste; things can be done slowly.
Tips.example: Explore the museum exhibits at your leisure, there’s no hurry.

Tips.title: Comfort Emphasis
Tips.description: Using leisure in this context often highlights a comfortable, stress-free experience.
Tips.example: After the guests left, they cleaned up at their leisure.

Downtime.wordDefinition:
Downtime refers to the time that is not being used for work or other activities that are necessary or important. It is the time when a person is free but not necessarily engaged in any specific activity.

Downtime is free time that can be used for activities that may or may not be enjoyable, while leisure time is a specifically planned time when one engages in activities that they find enjoyable and fulfilling.

Employ.wordDefinition:
Employ means to have a job or work, while leisure means free time or time spent not working. Employ is applicable in the context of work or employment, while leisure is applicable in the context of hobbies, relaxation, and recreation.

For example, someone may be employed as a doctor and have leisure time spent playing sports or reading.

Idle.wordDefinition:
Idle refers to someone or something that is not doing anything productive or useful. For example, a person who is lounging around all day without doing any work is considered idle.

Idle is often used in a negative sense to describe someone who is lazy, unproductive or wasting time.

Idle refers to doing nothing while leisure refers to doing something enjoyable during one's free time.

Inactivity.wordDefinition:
Inactivity refers to the state of not doing anything or being idle.

It can be applicable when someone is not engaged in any physical or mental activity. For example, if someone is lying on the couch and not moving or thinking, they are in a state of inactivity.

Relaxation.wordDefinition:
Relaxation is a state of being in which you feel calm, peaceful and free from stress.

Relaxation can be done through meditation, yoga, or any other activity that helps you feel relaxed.

Leisure is a period of time when you can engage in enjoyable activities while relaxation is a state of being calm and free of stress.

Leisure time can be used for relaxation, but relaxation can also be done at any time during the day.

Rest.wordDefinition:
Rest refers to a state of relaxation or recovery from physical or mental activity. It is necessary for our bodies and minds to function properly.

For example, taking a nap after a tiring day or sleeping in on the weekend is rest time.

Leisure is an activity you choose to do for fun in your free time, while rest is a state of relaxation or recovery that is necessary for our well-being.

Vacancy.wordDefinition:
Vacancy means an empty or unoccupied space or job position. For example, a hotel might have a vacancy in one of its rooms or a company might have a vacancy for a new employee.

So, while leisure refers to free time for enjoyable activities, vacancy refers to a space or job position that needs to be filled.

quotes.Text: Economics works great for planning your life when you don't have a work passion, since we tend to assume that your job delivers only money and you trade off job hours with leisure hours. If you think your job will just be a job, pick one that pays well per hour and leaves you some time off, even if the activity of the job is boring.
